trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> class is designed to contain a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> objects.
It is used primarily by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control to manage collections of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> objects.

A display mode is a special view of a Web page that appears when it is assigned as the current display mode on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.DisplayMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Display modes are used in the Web Parts control set to create page views in which users can carry out special tasks, such as editing controls, or rearranging the layout of a page.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control defines several display modes, including <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.BrowseDisplayMode>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.DesignDisplayMode>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.EditDisplayMode>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.CatalogDisplayMode>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.ConnectDisplayMode>.
The collection of display modes is referenced by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.DisplayModes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
On any particular Web page that uses Web Parts controls, only certain display modes are available.
The default browse mode and the design mode are nearly always available, but the other display modes are available only if their corresponding zone types are present on the page.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> class overview.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control keeps track of the available display modes on a page with its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.SupportedDisplayModes%2A> property.
This property references a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> object that contains all the supported display modes.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> class does not have an exposed constructor, so you cannot create your own new instance of it.

If you create a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> object and want it to be part of the collection of supported display modes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control, you must inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class, override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.CreateDisplayModes%2A> method, call the base method to create the collection, and then add any custom display modes to the collection by using its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Add%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> class has two public properties.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.IsReadOnly%2A> property is a read-only property that indicates whether the collection is read-only.
The overloaded <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Item%2A> property provides access to the members of the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> class also has several methods.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Add%2A> method, already mentioned, enables you to add <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> objects to the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Contains%2A> method determines whether a particular display mode exists in the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.CopyTo%2A> method copies the collection to an array of objects.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.IndexOf%2A> method returns the index of a particular display mode within the collection.
Finally, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Insert%2A> method enables you to insert a display mode object at a particular index in the collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> object to the collection.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Add%2A> method to add new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> objects to an existing <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> object.

An example of a scenario in which you would do this is when you create a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> class, and you want to add it to the collection of supported display modes on a page.

To do that, you must inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class and override its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.CreateDisplayModes%2A> method, first calling the base method, and then using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Add%2A> method to add the custom display mode to the collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> to add to the collection.
An integer value that indicates where the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> was inserted into the collection.
Returns a value indicating whether a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> object exists in the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to check a particular <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> object and determine whether it is in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> object.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> being checked for its existence in a collection.
A Boolean value that indicates whether value exists in the collection.
Copies the collection to an array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.CopyTo%2A> method is useful when you want to create a custom array to programmatically manipulate a set of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> objects.
An array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> objects to contain the copied collection.
An integer that indicates the starting point in the array at which to place the collection contents.
Returns the position of a particular member of the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.IndexOf%2A> method is useful if you have multiple <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> objects, and you need to know the ordinal position (the index) of one object relative to the others.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> that is a member of the collection.
An integer that indicates the position of a particular object in the collection.
Inserts a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> object into the collection at the specified index position.
If `index` equals the number of items in the collection, then `value` is appended to the end of the collection.
An integer indicating the ordinal position in the collection at which a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> should be inserted.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> to insert into the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.IsReadOnly%2A> property value is changed internally by the Web Parts control set as it changes the contents of the collection at different points.

For example, after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control has added all supported display modes to its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.SupportedDisplayModes%2A> collection, it internally sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> object to read-only to prevent it from being changed.
There is no mechanism to change this property value from your code, although you can read its value.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the collection is read-only.
Gets a specific member of the collection according to its index.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Item%2A> property enables you to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> object within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> collection by using an index number that represents its ordinal position in the collection.
An integer that indicates the index of a member of the collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
Gets a specific member of the collection according to a unique identifier.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection.Item%2A> property enables you to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> object within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCollection> collection by using a string identifier for a particular display mode.
A string that contains the name of a particular display mode in the collection.
The first whose mode name matches the value of the modeName parameter.
